intro: Cynorkis flexuosa var. ambongensis, commonly known as the Ambongensis Cynorkis, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in warm climates.
